segments.en: Hello, everyone, and welcome back to another great lesson with EnglishPod.
segments.cn: 大家好，欢迎回到EnglishPod的另一堂精彩课程。

segments.en: Erica, today we have a great intermediate lesson.
segments.cn: Erica，今天我们有一堂很棒的中级课程。

segments.en: That's right, we've got a lesson about love.
segments.cn: 没错，我们有一堂关于爱的课程。

segments.en: Especially if you have a girlfriend or boyfriend, right?
segments.cn: 特别是如果你有女朋友或男朋友，对吧？

segments.en: Okay, so why don't we start by looking at our vocabulary preview.
segments.cn: 好吧，那我们先来看一下我们的词汇预览。

segments.en: In today's vocabulary preview, we will learn two important words from our dialogue.
segments.cn: 在今天的词汇预览中，我们将学习对话中的两个重要单词。

segments.en: So that's a really simple one.
segments.cn: 这是一个非常简单的词。

segments.en: When you knock something over, you make it fall down.
segments.cn: 当你撞倒某物时，你使它掉下来。

segments.en: Speaking of knocking things over, this morning I knocked over my coffee cup.
segments.cn: 说到撞倒东西，今天早上我把咖啡杯撞倒了。

segments.en: You almost ruined our lesson plan for today.
segments.cn: 你差点毁了我们今天的课程计划。

segments.en: It was all over the place.
Okay, let's look at our second word.
segments.cn: 好吧，让我们看看第二个单词。

segments.en: So when something explodes, this is what happens.
segments.cn: 所以当某物爆炸时，会发生这样的事情。

segments.en: That's more than clear, I think.
segments.cn: 我认为这比清楚还要清楚。

segments.en: So now we've looked at our two vocabulary preview words for this dialogue, and we are ready to listen to it for the first time.
segments.cn: 现在我们已经看过对话中的两个词汇预览单词，我们准备第一次听它。

segments.en: Just let me try to stand up.
I think I know you from somewhere.
segments.cn: 我想我在某个地方见过你。

segments.en: I think we've met somewhere before.
We met at Aaron's place last weekend.
segments.cn: 我们上周末在Aaron的地方见过。

segments.en: But anyway, I'm glad to see you're not badly hurt.
segments.cn: 不过，我很高兴看到你没有受重伤。

segments.en: And I should probably get going.
I've got a nine o'clock meeting.
Call me and we'll exchange insurance information.
segments.cn: 给我打电话，我们交换保险信息。

segments.en: You can't just leave me like this.
I'm canceling my appointment so that I can stay here with you.
segments.cn: 我取消了我的约会，以便可以留在这里陪你。

segments.en: Oh my god, he is amazing.
I would love to meet a guy like that.
segments.cn: 我真想见到这样的家伙。

segments.en: Okay, well I think it's time to look at some of the language in this dialogue.
segments.cn: 好吧，我想是时候看看这个对话中的一些语言了。

segments.en: Let's start with our language takeaway.
segments.cn: 让我们从语言要点开始。

segments.en: Today we have three important words from our dialogue that we will learn for our language takeaway.
segments.cn: 今天我们有三个重要的单词来自我们的对话，我们将学习这些语言要点。

segments.en: This one I think is a little bit hard to explain.
segments.cn: 这个我觉得有点难以解释。

segments.en: Yeah, so let's listen to some examples on how we use familiar.
segments.cn: 是的，所以让我们听一些关于如何使用“熟悉”的例子。
这个名字听起来很熟悉。

segments.en: Where have I heard it before?
Do you know where we are?
Did we go to high school together?
segments.cn: 我们是一起上高中的吗？

segments.en: So when something's familiar, you think you know it, but you're not exactly sure.
segments.cn: 所以当某事是熟悉的，你觉得你认识它，但你不完全确定。

segments.en: So when we refer to place, we refer to house.
segments.cn: 所以当我们提到地方时，我们指的是房子。

segments.en: So I can say, hey Marco, come over to my place for dinner tonight.
segments.cn: 所以我可以说，嘿，Marco，今晚来我家吃晚餐。

segments.en: Or I could say, we're having a party at my place tonight at eight.
segments.cn: 或者我可以说，今晚八点我们在我家开派对。

segments.en: You might ask someone, how's your new place?
segments.cn: 你可能会问某人，你的新家怎么样？
我们今天的最后一个词是...

segments.en: So, again, we have some great examples for you to understand how we use coincidence.
segments.cn: 所以，再次，我们有一些很好的例子来帮助你理解我们如何使用巧合。

segments.en: I'm going to New York this weekend.
By coincidence, everyone in the room was named Alex.
segments.cn: 恰巧，房间里每个人都叫Alex。
我们是纯粹的巧合相遇的。

segments.en: One day we ran into each other on our bikes, and we've been together ever since.
segments.cn: 有一天我们在骑自行车时碰到了对方，从那以后我们就在一起了。

segments.en: A coincidence is something that happens by chance, right?
segments.cn: 巧合是偶然发生的事情，对吧？

segments.en: Yeah, these funny little things happen all the time.
segments.cn: 是的，这些有趣的小事情总是发生。

segments.en: I love it when these coincidences happen.
segments.cn: 我喜欢这些巧合发生的时候。

segments.en: So Erica, why don't you tell us about a coincidence that's happened to you?
segments.cn: 所以Erica，为什么不告诉我们一个发生在你身上的巧合？

segments.en: Well, the other night I was having dinner in a restaurant, and I looked up and I saw my old professor from university.
segments.cn: 嗯，前几天晚上我在餐厅吃晚餐，抬头看到我大学的老教授。

segments.en: It was such a coincidence because here we are in Shanghai, and I see my professor from Canada having dinner at the table next to me.
segments.cn: 这真是个巧合，因为我们在上海，而我看到我来自加拿大的教授在我旁边的桌子上吃晚餐。

segments.en: Or has it ever happened to you that you're thinking of someone and that person calls you?
segments.cn: 或者你有没有经历过这样的事情，你在想某人，而那个人打电话给你？

segments.en: Okay, so now that we have learned these three language takeaway words, we can listen to our dialogue a second time, but this time it's going to be slower.
segments.cn: 好吧，现在我们已经学会了这三个语言要点词汇，我们可以再听一遍对话，但这次会慢一点。

segments.en: I didn't mean to knock you over.
My tire just exploded, and I lost control of my bike.
segments.cn: 我的轮胎突然爆了，我失去了对自行车的控制。

segments.en: Just let me try to stand up.
I think I know you from somewhere.
segments.cn: 我想我在某个地方见过你。

segments.en: Yeah, I think we have met somewhere before.
segments.cn: 是的，我想我们以前见过。

segments.en: We met at Aaron's place last weekend.
But anyway, I'm glad to see that you're not badly hurt, and I should probably get going.
segments.cn: 不过，我很高兴看到你没有受重伤，我应该走了。

segments.en: I have a nine o'clock meeting, but here's my number.
segments.cn: 我有一个九点的会议，但这是我的号码。

segments.en: Call me and we'll exchange insurance information.
segments.cn: 给我打电话，我们交换保险信息。

segments.en: You can't just leave me like this.
No, I'm canceling my appointment so that I can stay here with you.
segments.cn: 不，我在取消我的预约，以便可以留在这里陪你。

segments.en: Well, that was much clearer, wasn't it?
segments.cn: 嗯，那样清楚多了，不是吗？

segments.en: And this brings us to Fluency Builder.
segments.cn: 这让我们进入流利度提升环节。

segments.en: Fluency Builder In today's Fluency Builder, we're going to show you different ways of apologizing.
segments.cn: 流利度提升 在今天的流利度提升中，我们将向你展示不同的道歉方式。

segments.en: It's so important to be able to apologize well and fluently.
segments.cn: 能够流利地道歉是非常重要的。

segments.en: And you also want to say something different from, I'm sorry.
segments.cn: 你还想说一些不同于“我很抱歉”的话。

segments.en: That's what we're going to show you today.
segments.cn: 这就是我们今天要展示的内容。

segments.en: We heard some great expressions for, I'm sorry, in the dialogue.
segments.cn: 我们在对话中听到了一些很好的“我很抱歉”的表达。

segments.en: I say this one all the time.
Yeah, it's a great way of saying, I'm sorry.
segments.cn: 是的，这是表达“我很抱歉”的好方法。

segments.en: Now also, if you want to say, I'm sorry, you also want to tell the person that you made a mistake, right?
segments.cn: 现在，如果你想说“我很抱歉”，你也想告诉对方你犯了错误，对吧？

segments.en: And we did hear some wonderful expressions for, I made a mistake, in this dialogue.
segments.cn: 我们在对话中听到了一些很好的“我犯了错误”的表达。

segments.en: I didn't mean to knock you over.
I didn't mean to knock you over.
Well, I didn't mean to knock my coffee cup over this morning.
segments.cn: 嗯，我今天早上不是故意把咖啡杯打翻的。

segments.en: So all of these phrases are really useful and great for apologizing and telling someone you made a mistake.
segments.cn: 所以这些短语真的很有用，适合道歉和告诉别人你犯了错误。

segments.en: Well, it's time for us to listen to our dialogue a third time.
segments.cn: 好吧，是时候让我们第三次听对话了。

segments.en: This time it'll be at its normal speed and I think you'll be able to understand a little bit better.
segments.cn: 这次会以正常速度进行，我想你会更好理解。

segments.en: I really didn't mean to knock you over.
segments.cn: 我真的不是故意把你撞倒的。

segments.en: My tire just exploded and I lost control of my bike.
segments.cn: 我的轮胎突然爆了，我失去了对自行车的控制。

segments.en: Just let me try to stand up.
I think I know you from somewhere.
segments.cn: 我想我在某个地方见过你。

segments.en: I think we've met somewhere before.
We met at Aaron's place last weekend.
segments.cn: 我们上周末在亚伦家见过。

segments.en: But anyway, I'm glad to see you're not badly hurt and I should probably get going.
segments.cn: 不过，我很高兴看到你没有受重伤，我应该走了。

segments.en: I've got a nine o'clock meeting.
Call me and we'll exchange insurance information.
segments.cn: 给我打电话，我们交换保险信息。

segments.en: You can't just leave me like this.
I'm canceling my appointment so that I can stay here with you.
segments.cn: 我取消了我的约会，以便可以留在这里陪你。

segments.en: Great dialogue and great music, right?
segments.cn: 很棒的对话和很棒的音乐，对吧？

segments.en: Well, speaking of a romantic type, do you believe in love at first sight?
segments.cn: 嗯，说到浪漫类型，你相信一见钟情吗？

segments.en: Well, I think the first time that you see someone, it impresses you some way and you feel attracted to that person.
segments.cn: 嗯，我认为第一次见到某人时，会给你留下某种印象，你会对那个人产生吸引。

segments.en: At least it's the first feeling that you get that makes you want to talk to that person or get to know that person.
segments.cn: 至少这是你想要与那个人交谈或了解那个人的第一感觉。

segments.en: When I see somebody for the first time, my first impression is always wrong.
segments.cn: 当我第一次见到某人时，我的第一印象总是错的。

segments.en: So if I see someone and I like them at the beginning, in three weeks I'll hate them.
segments.cn: 所以如果我一开始喜欢某人，三周后我就会讨厌他们。

segments.en: And if I see someone and I don't like them when I first meet them, I'll be their best friend.
segments.cn: 如果我一开始不喜欢某人，我就会成为他们的好朋友。

segments.en: So love at first sight doesn't work for me.
segments.cn: 所以一见钟情对我来说不管用。

segments.en: I'm sure that our listeners have some stories that love at first sight.
segments.cn: 我相信我们的听众有一些关于一见钟情的故事。

segments.en: Maybe they've met their wives or their boyfriends in this way.
segments.cn: 也许他们以这种方式遇到了他们的妻子或男朋友。

segments.en: I'd like to hear about it.
And if anybody knows the name of the songs we used, also be sure to post it on the discussion board.
segments.cn: 如果有人知道我们使用的歌曲的名字，也请在讨论区发布。

segments.en: So that's all for today everyone, but be sure to go to our website at EnglishPod.com.
segments.cn: 所以今天就到这里，但请务必访问我们的网站 EnglishPod.com。

segments.en: And as we said, leave all your comments, your stories, and see if you know the name of the songs.
segments.cn: 正如我们所说，留下你的评论、故事，看看你是否知道这些歌曲的名字。

segments.en: Okay, well thanks for listening everyone, and until next time, goodbye!
segments.cn: 好吧，谢谢大家的收听，下次再见，拜拜！
